results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = binomial(n,k) + binomial(n,k+2) (0 <= k <= n).
comment: Binomial transform of the infinite tridiagonal matrix with main diagonal, (1,1,1,...), subdiagonal, (0,0,0,...) and subsubdiagonal, (1,1,1,...). Sum of entries in row n = 2^(n+1) - n - 1 = A000325(n+1).
example: First few rows of the triangle are
maple: T:=(n,k)->binomial(n,k)+binomial(n,k+2): for n from 0 to 12 do seq(T(n,k),k=0..n) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_ and _Roger L. Bagula_, Nov 05 2006
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 29 2006
